results.title: Kissin' cousins
results.creator_credit: Gene Nelson, Sam Katzman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Elvis Presley plays a dual role in this film - Airforce Lieutenant Josh Morgan, and a countrified Jody Tatum. Morgan is sent by the Government on the unenviable job of trying to secure hillbilly land for a proposed missile base. Much to Morgan’s surprise he is faced with a blonde, country version of himself which means double the songs and women. Cast also includes Arthur O’Connell, Glenda Farrell, Jack Albertson and Pam Austin. Includes the following songs; “Kissin cousins”, “Barefoot ballad” and “Tender feeling”.

results.title: Hot potato
results.creator_credit: Oscar Williams, Paul Heller, Fred Weintraub and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Hot Potato is the follow up to “Black Belt Jones!” and sees Jim Kelly reprising his title role. Filmed in Thailand, the film follows the adventures of agent Jones (Kelly) who is sent to Thailand to rescue the daughter of a US Senator kidnapped by a power hungry Thai warlord. Jones teams up with local agent Pam (Irene Tsu), together with his regular sidekicks Chicago (Geoffrey Binney) and Rhino (George Memmoli). Jim Kelly who is an International Middleweight Karate Champion choreographed the film’s fight scenes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Oscar Williams, Paul Heller, Fred Weintraub and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: Love story = A Woman surrenders
results.creator_credit: Leslie Arliss, Harold Huth and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Two people are drawn together in Cornwall during World War II by their shared misfortune. Lissa (Margaret Lockwood), a brilliant concert pianist suffering from a potentially fatal heart condition becomes romantically involved with engaged RAF pilot Kit (Stewart Granger), who is slowly going blind. Neither of the two knows of the predicament of the other, and keeps secret their personal drama. When Lissa learns of Kit’s blindness, she tries to convince him into having a dangerous and experimental operation to restore his sight. Conflict ensues when Lissa and Kit’s financee are at loggerheads as to whether Kit should have the surgery. Cast also includes Patricia Roc, Tom Walls and Reginald Purdell. Screenplay by Leslie Arliss and Doreen Montgomery from a short story by J. W. Drawbell. “Cornish rhapsody” composed by Hubert Bath, played by the National Symphony Orchestra and conducted by Sidney Beer. Solo pianoforte by Harriet Cohen.

results.title: To Paris with love
results.creator_credit: Robert Hamer, Antony Darnborough and Two Cities Films
results.brief_description: When a father decides that his son needs to be educated in learning about the fairer sex as well as life outside their blue blooded world, they head to the city which epitomises romance, Paris. Thus, Sir Edgar (Alec Guinness) and his 20 year old son begin a combined quest which appears completed when they meet the beautiful and spirited Lizette (Odile Versois). Complications arise when partner swapping appears on the cards. Sir Edgar finds himself falling in love with his son’s intended and his son too has fallen for the older woman (Elina Labourdette) he has found for his father. Cast also includes Vernon Gray.

results.title: The Wind cannot read
results.creator_credit: Ralph Thomas, Betty E. Box and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: It’s 1942, and Flight Lt. Michael Quinn (Dirk Bogarde) finds himself in Delhi to participate in a Japanese language course for interrogators of prisoners of war. His instructor is the beautiful Suzuki San (Yoko Tani), and the two fall in love and secretly marry. Tragedy befalls the newly wed couple when Michael returns to Burma and is captured and tortured by the Japanese. He is painfully reminded of the tenuous nature of their inter racial romance when he hears her voice broadcasting anti British propaganda. At first heartbroken, he vows to be reunited with his love when he discovers she is suffering from a terminal illness. Using love as inspiration, Michael vows to escape from prison and see his wife one more time before death separates them forever. Cast also includes John Fraser, Ronald Lewis, Anthony Bushell, Ken Okawa and Donald Pleasance. Based on the novel of the same name by Richard Mason.

results.title: Love streams
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Yoram Globus, Menahem Golan and Cannon Group
results.brief_description: In Cassavetes’ films the meaning behind love, relationships and identity cannot be easily apprehended because characters are always placed in the thick of things. “Love Streams” is about a brother and sister with different approaches to love, who come together to ease each other’s trouble. Robert Harmon doesn’t know how to establish lines of communication with his son, girlfriend and ex-wife. On the other hand, his sister, Sarah Lawson, repels her daughter and husband with her obsessive love. In an early scene Sarah states to the court that “love is a continuous stream”. The saying informs the rest of the director’s work, where the characters’ personal dilemmas perpetuate their own life.

results.title: Opening night
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Al Ruban and Faces Distribution Corporation
results.brief_description: Myrtle Gordon is a successful actress who finds the part she has taken in a new play, about a “defeated, older woman”, humiliating. When a young fan is killed outside the theatre one night, Myrtle uses the experience of the girl and the accident to revisit her youth. While she searches for a vantage-point to perform the part, the film shows how the play and the world behind the play interact and threaten to draw her into collapse.

results.title: A Woman under the influence
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Sam Shaw and Faces International Films Inc
results.brief_description: The title of this film refers to a wife and mother, Mabel Longhetti, who moves completely under the influence of her family and other people. She tries so hard to perform and conform, according to what she perceives they want, but she just comes across as “crazy” and the family are embarrassed. In the confusion, the film makes Mabel an expressive centre, focusing on the commotion she causes and the forms of agitation that extend across her face and body.

results.title: The Killing of a Chinese bookie
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Al Ruban and Faces Distribution Corporation
results.brief_description: The Killing of a Chinese Bookie presents a portrait of a man who is so self-sufficient that he cannot become personally involved with anyone. Cosmo Vitelli, played by Ben Gazzara, is a nightclub owner who believes in conducting his personal and business affairs with plenty of flair and professionalism. When the mob threatens him he works desperately to save his face and the club.

results.title: Faces
results.creator_credit: John Cassavetes, Maurice McEndree and Walter Reade Organization
results.brief_description: Faces concentrates on two scenarios, one where middle-aged businessmen cheat on their wives and the other where the wives bring home a younger man from a nightclub. Both wives and husbands take turns in testing the novelty of the situations, initially improvising to bridge the awkwardness but then risking more and more. While the night out feels liberating, it ends up tearing painfully at their conservative personas.
